intro: Amsinckia inflatula, commonly known as the inflated poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its distinctive, inflated seed pods that resemble small balloons, which give it its common name. The plant produces showy, bright yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky habitats. Amsinckia inflatula is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other poppy species.
